Articles.Content:
They would like to know how to get an unmanned rocket into orbit. 

Please help. Thanks.
And they want the code for the "Revert Flight" option
They just need to add moar boosters then they should be good to go.
Struts. They don't use enough struts.
As far as I know, no amount of space-tape will prevent an oxygen-tank overpressure.
Maybe we can link them some of the Scott Manley videos, so they can learn how to do a proper gravity turn...

> 
> As far as I know, no amount of space-tape will prevent an oxygen-tank overpressure.

Okay, boosters then.

> 
> Okay, boosters then.

Hey, if we could get the thing into orbit in less then 2 minutes, we wouldn't have to worry about the tanks exploding ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Sounds like they didn't avoid reentry affects on the way up.

Do you really think it's completely okay to make fun of a disaster that's left many people depressed and/or furiously angry? If you're doing it just for the sake of looking offensive or cool, you're failing pretty badly and you simply look like an edgy teenager.
As this thread is neither about KSP nor the real flight, it's not really suited for our forum.
